greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of iterations required for happy number A007770(n) to converge to 1.
comment: The count includes both the start and end.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Happy Number
T. Cai, Xia Zhou, On the heights of happy numbers, Rocky Mount. J. Math. 38 (6) (2008) 1921. [From _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 22 2010]
example: 7 is the 2nd happy number and iterated digit squarings and additions give the sequence {7,49,97,130,10,1}, so a(2)=6.
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Nov 30 2003
